relatedanime.anime: Sekai Meisaku Gekijou Kanketsu Ban: Princess Sara

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch17639 [Sara], a pretty girl born into a rich British family in India, is treated like a little princess at a dormitory school in London. Sara`s sweet school life turns to tragedy when she learns of her father`s death and the family`s bankruptcy. However, Sara endures her hard luck with kindness and imagination and escapes from her misery through fantasies. Source: AnimeNfo

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shoujo
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shoujo, literally meaning "girl", refers to a female audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: all-girls school
tag.description: This school is only for female students. There may be a few male teachers though.

tag.name: orphan
tag.description: The character (in common usage: only a child, or the young of an animal) has lost both parents.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: past
tag.description: Anime that takes place in the past or clearly seems to take place in the past in case of an alternative universe. This category should almost always go together with one of its sub-categories, because the past can either be a depiction of a historical event(s) or not, in which case it would be alternative past.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: novel
tag.description: A novel is a relatively long work of narrative fiction, normally written in prose form, and which is typically published as a book. Manga, comics, or visual novels do not fit this description and are not considered novels; including a small number of illustrations, however, is still permissible, which means that light novels are considered novels.

tag.name: United Kingdom
tag.description: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, commonly known as the United Kingdom (UK) or Britain, is a sovereign country in western Europe. Lying off the north-western coast of the European mainland, the UK includes the island of Great Britain, the north-eastern part of the island of Ireland and many smaller islands. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Europe
tag.description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. It comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: coming of age
tag.description: In the strict sense the Coming of age describes a young person`s transition from adolescence to adulthood. In anime the term is used in a more general sense where the protagonists have to face a challenge, make an important decision in their life, take on responsibility, or learn a lesson, and by overcoming these obstacles they reach a higher level of maturity.

tag.name: bullying
tag.description: Bullying is the use of force, threat, or coercion to abuse, intimidate, or aggressively dominate others. One who engages in bullying is known as a bully. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Sekai Meisaku Gekijou
tag.description: World Masterpiece Theatre is a Japanese TV anime staple that showcases an animated version of a different classical book or story each year. It originally aired from 1969 to 1997 and then resumed in 2007. WMT series were originally produced by http://anidb.net/cr833 [Mushi Production] and Zuiyo Eizo, and then by the latter`s successor http://anidb.net/cr728 [Nippon Animation], and originally air primarily on http://anidb.net/cr741 [Fuji Television]. The series has been known by various different names over the years, often reflecting changes to the sponsors, but "World Masterpiece Theatre" is the name most commonly used by viewers. Nippon Animation`s official English name for the series is The Classic Family Theater Series. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: strong female lead
tag.description: The lead female character has a strong personality and plays a part that is not the typical damsel-in-distress role. This is the exact opposite of the “damsel in distress” tag.

tag.name: poverty
tag.description: It refers to the condition of not having the means to afford basic human needs.

tag.name: birthday
tag.description: All about the birthday celebration of at least one of the protagonists in this anime. This includes a birthday party with a birthday cake and other food and presents — lots of them.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO EPISODE
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to episode tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what episodes they should be assigned to.

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

character.name: Sara Crewe
character.description: Sara Crewe is a young daughter of a wealthy English family in India, who starts attending an all-girl`s seminary selection boarding school in London, where she excels in her studies and is loved deeply by many of her friends and classmates. However, tragedy soon strikes when Sara`s father passes away and her family goes bankrupt, leaving her to be a poor orphan. The school`s headmistress, Miss Minchin, takes advantage of this situation and makes her a maid in the school, trying hard to make her life as miserable as possible. However, Sara, with the help of her friends, perseveres and tries to endure all her hardships until redemption comes at last.

character.name: Ralph Crewe
character.description: Sara`s father is a rich English businessman living in India alone with his daughter after his wife died at child birth. He sends his daughter to a boarding school in London where she is supposed to get to know more of the world. Unfortunately he ends up bankrupt after a poor investment and shortly thereafter is stricken by yellow fever and dies. The news of his bancrupcy and death arrive in London right at the time of his daughter`s birthday party, leaving Sara overnight penyless and without anybody to rely on.

character.name: Maria Minchin
character.description: Miss Minchin is the headmistress of the Miss Minchin Select Seminary for Young Ladies (Minchin Kishuku Joshi Gakuin (ミンチン寄宿女子学院)) where most of the story takes place. She is very fond of money, and thus treats the girls that have money-spending parents behind them with a very friendly manner. Sara lost her graces with Miss Minchin, when the money stopped coming due to the events that took place.

character.name: Barrow
character.description: Barrow is Ralph Crewe`s lawyer/solicitor/representative in London. He handles the caretaking of Sara at the new school.

character.name: Amelia Minchin
character.description: Amelia is Miss Minchin`s younger sister. She also works in the school, but has a much nicer and more gentle personality than her sister.

character.name: James
character.description: James is part of the staff in the school. He`s the cook.

character.name: Mariette
character.description: Mariette becomes Sara`s personal maid when she is coming into Miss Minchin`s school.

character.name: Peter
character.description: Peter is part of a very poor family from London. He was taught how to drive a carriage by his father, and becomes friends with Sara very fast - much to the anger of Miss Minchin.

character.name: Youfukuya Shujin
character.description: The owner of the tailor shop (Youfukuya Shujin).

character.name: Ermengarde St. John
character.description: Ermengarde is the worst pupil in the school. Because of her bad grades, her father, a senior teacher, isn`t quite accepting her. She`s a shy girl and thus gets bullied a lot by Lavinia and her little gang. Ermengarde and Sara become friends very fast, resulting in Sara protecting her even.

character.name: Lavinia Herbert
character.description: Lavinia is the oldest pupil in the school. She`s from south america and the daughter of a couple that made quite some money with oil and are said to have contacts with the president. She hates Sara the most and is against her from the very beginning.

character.name: Lotty Lei
character.description: With her only being 4 years old, Lotty is the youngest in the school. For her, Sara becomes like a mother. Her own mother is dead. Lotty is seen crying a lot.

character.name: Bonaparte
character.description: Bonaparte is Sara`s pet cockatoo that she brought with herself from India.

character.name: Gertrude
character.description: Gertrude belongs to Lavinia`s closest friends.

character.name: Dolcilla
character.description: Dolcilla`s father is the director of a coal mine.

character.name: Linda
character.description: Linda`s father is the chief engineer of a railway company.

character.name: Crystal
character.description: Crystal is from Manchester.

character.name: Jennifer
character.description: Jennifer is being introduced by Lavinia as the mischievous girl.

character.name: Penelope
character.description: The daughter of a physician.

character.name: Jane
character.description: Jane`s father is the manager of a factory.

character.name: Susan
character.description: Susan`s father is a soldier.

character.name: Dufarge
character.description: The french teacher.

character.name: Caesar
character.description: Caesar is the institute`s housecat. He`s mischivious, yet very clumsy.

character.name: Hanaya-san
character.description: A woman that sells flowers in the flower shop where Sara and Ermengarde make a stop to buy some.

character.name: Ermengarde no Chichi
character.description: The father of Ermengarde. He appears to be a very smart teacher. He despises his daughter for her bad grades and compares her to his little sister Eliza in regards of that.

character.name: Eliza Obasan
character.description: Eliza is the aunt of Ermengarde, and the little sister of Ermengarde`s father. Ermengarde`s father thinks both Eliza and Ermengarde are not very intelligent.

character.name: Molly
character.description: Molly is part of the seminary`s staff. She works in the kitchen.

character.name: Becky
character.description: Coming from Ashfield, one day Becky becomes part of the staff of Miss Minchin`s Seminary. Being a rather clumsy person, she`s not much liked by the rest of the staff, least Miss Minchin herself. Becky herself is like a mirror of poverty to Sara, being mistreated and punished a lot. Becky is illiterate. Sara is the only one who treats Becky like a person.

character.name: Shichou-fujin
character.description: The mayoresse (Shichou Fujin) that comes to visit the seminary.

character.name: Cake-ten Shujin
character.description: The owner of the cake shop (Cake-ten Shujin) where Sara buys sweets for her tea party.

character.name: Donald
character.description: Donald is a young boy. He`s the son of rich parents. When going out, the servants even roll out a red carpet for them, so they won`t get dirty / need to step on the ground when entering their carriage. His mother brought him up very well and taught him, to help those in needs. He meets Sara on the first of May, when she is out shopping for produce, dizzy from not having had any food for a longer period of time, and insists that she takes some money from him, to buy food for herself. This moment had to be the first time that Sara had to realize how poor and dependend of others she has become.

character.name: Lavinia no Chichi
character.description: Lavinia`s father. Got rich with oil.

character.name: Lavinia no Haha
character.description: Lavinia`s mother.

character.name: Pan`ya no Obasan
character.description: She`s the woman that works at the bakery, Sara is buying food from.

character.name: Anne
character.description: The very hungry and poor girl (shoujo) that Sara spends the money she finds on in the bakery.

character.name: Rou Shisai
character.description: An old priest (Rou Shisai) Sara asks for advice after she finds a coin on the streets.

character.name: Pan`ya no Shujin
character.description: The husband of the kind baker.

character.name: Eki`in
character.description: An employer of the train company (Eki`in) that Becky meets when arriving in Ashfield.

character.name: Teddy
character.description: Teddy is Becky`s little brother. He`s still living in Ashfield together with their mother and little sister Martha.

character.name: Martha
character.description: Martha is Becky`s little sister, still living in Ashfield together with their brother Teddy and mother. Note: Martha wrongly appears in the credits as アーサ, which would make her named Arthur.

character.name: Haha
character.description: Becky`s mother (Haha) who still lives in Ashfield, together with her own mother and her three of four kids.

character.name: Shujin
character.description: Who can take a sunrise sprinkle it with dew Cover it with choc`late and a miracle or two The Candy Man oh the Candy Man can The Candy Man can `cause he mixes it with love And makes the world taste good This guy is the employer (Shujin) of the candy shop Becky wants to buy sweets in. He`s the Candy Man.

character.name: Yuubinya-san
character.description: The mail man (Yuubinya-san) that delivers the mail to the seminary.

character.name: Carmichael
character.description: Mister Carmichael is the Solicitor of Mister Carrisford.

character.name: Ram Dass
character.description: Ram Dass, despite his looks, is a very strong man. He`s part of Mister Carrisford`s staff and is seen carrying Mister Carrisford together with the wheelchair out of a carriage, without any sign of hardship.

character.name: Tom Carrisford
character.description: Tom Carrisford is a rich businessman. Due to the aftereffects of an illness, he`s bound to a wheelchair. One day he moves into the empty house next door to the seminary, unknown to everybody what fate he brings with him. Besides his looks, Amelia heard from Molly that he`s not even 30 years in age.

character.name: Janet Carmichael
character.description: Janet is the sister of Donald. They`re both the children of Mister Carmichael, Mister Carrisford`s solicitor, and friend.

character.name: Shounen
character.description: The boy (Shounen) who repairs the broken window.

character.name: Wild-sensei
character.description: A doctor who likes to cure himself with ale.

character.name: Jim
character.description: Jim is a chimneysweeper and a friend (or something like that) of Peter.

character.name: Ojisan
character.description: Bartender/Owner of the pub Doctor Wild is being found in by Sara.

character.name: Peter no Haha
character.description: Peter`s bedridden mother.

character.name: Peter no Chichi
character.description: Peter`s father.

character.name: Maggie
character.description: Maggie is the boss of a place that makes and sells matches. Sara starts working there.

character.name: Fujin
character.description: Carmichael`s wife, mother of Janet and Donald.

episode.title: デュワルジュ先生の帰国
The Homecoming of Msr. Dufarge
Das Ende einer Freundschaft
Au revoir monsieur Dufarge
Dufarge-sensei no Kikoku
一日だけのシンデレラ
Cinderella for one Day
Der Französischunterricht
La visite de la femme du Préfet
Ichinichi Dake no Cinderella
嵐の中のつぐない
Redemption in the Middle of the Storm
Retter in der Not
Première tempête d`automne
Arashi no Naka no Tsugunai
馬小屋の寒い夜
A Cold Night in the Stable
Eine harte Zeit für Sara
Dans l`étable
Umagoya no Samui Yoru
街の子ピーター
Peter, a Child of the Populace
Wiedersehen mit Peter
Peter, l`enfant de la ville
Machi no Ko Peter
